title.native: ダンガンロンパ3 -The End of 希望ヶ峰学園-　絶望編
title.romaji: Danganronpa 3: The End of Kibougamine Gakuen - Zetsubou-hen
title.english: Danganronpa 3: The End of Hope’s Peak High School - Despair Arc

description:
Chisa Yukizome begins her job as homeroom teacher for Hope's Peak Academy's 77th Class of Ultmate students. Meanwhile, Hajime Hinata, a student of the school's Reserve Course for students without talent, prepares to undergo an experiment to make him the Ultimate Hope. What follows is a series of tragic events which lead to the birth of the Remnants of Despair and the realization of "The Biggest, Most Awful, Most Tragic Event in Human History."


Aired alongside of Danganronpa 3: Mirai-hen, with Mirai-hen starting first.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Dystopian
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a society characterized by poverty, squalor or oppression.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Augmented Reality
tags.description: Prominently features events with augmented reality as the main setting.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Teacher
tags.description: Protagonist is an educator, usually in a school setting.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Bisexual
tags.description: Features a character who is romantically or sexually attracted to people of more than one sex or gender.

tags.name: Meta
tags.description: Features fourth wall-breaking references to itself or genre tropes.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Tanned Skin
tags.description: Prominently features characters with tanned skin.

tags.name: Chuunibyou
tags.description: Prominently features a character with "Middle School 2nd Year Syndrome", who either acts like a know-it-all adult or falsely believes they have special powers.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kazkodaka/)

A former employee of Spike Chunsoft and the co-founder of Too Kyo Games. He is primarily known for being the creator and scenario writer of the _Danganronpa_ video game series.

Rui Komatsuzaki is best known as the main concept artist of the Danganronpa franchise.

Komatsuzaki was a sculpture graduate before becoming involved with Spike, and Danganronpa was his first experience as a character designer.

(Source: Danganronpa Wiki)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nk12) 

Writer of the script for Guilty Gear Xtra, the Guilty Gear novels and the drama CDs.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/KoudenMS)

Masafumi Takada is a japanese composer and sound designer best known for his work on the soundtracks for killer7, God Hand, No More Heroes, and the Earth Defense Force and the Danganronpa series.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/93473950)

Worked as an assistant to [Shirou Oono](https://anilist.co/staff/132305/) in the late '90s.
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daiki_fukuoka)

**Daiki Fukuoka** is a Japanese director, episode director, production manager and storyboard artist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Megumi_Ogata) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/megumi_ogata_official/) | [Website](https://www.emou.net)

Ogata attended Tokai University, but left due to lack of interest. They then began working as a musical actress, attending the same classes alongside [Rumi Kasahara](https://anilist.co/staff/95996/) and [Shiho Niiyama](https://anilist.co/staff/95724/). Because of their husky voice, they are often typecast as either young men and boys or tomboyish females. It is also because of this that they are sometimes referred as "Aniki" (big brother) by fans.

In a speech at the 16th Seiyu Awards on March 5, 2022, Ogata had shared that they had been wary to accept "Best Leading Actress" as they mostly played boy characters and do not refer to themselves as an actress. Ogata also shared that "There is so much talk about being 'genderless' nowadays and there are voice actors in the industry who have come out. And like myself, there are people out there who go on about their daily lives mostly not thinking of themselves as women."

__Non-Anime Roles:__

- Fidelio Aureus Magnus - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
Musical group consisting of singers Nagi Yanagi and Annabel, arranger Yoshihisa Nagao (永尾ヨシヒサ), and visual artist xai.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/94072097)

Close friends with [Kai Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/132094/).

Married to fellow Animator [Reiko Nagasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/140343).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/94072097)

Close friends with [Kai Shibata](https://anilist.co/staff/132094/).

Married to fellow Animator [Reiko Nagasawa](https://anilist.co/staff/140343).
